wikipedia_page.main: Major Oliver Stewart MC AFC was a World War I flying ace credited with five aerial victories. Post war, he had a long and distinguished career as a writer.

response: Eleven flying aces had served in the squadron. They included Ernest James Salter, Henry Maddocks, George Hackwill, Frank Hudson, Francis Kitto, Oliver Sutton, Michael Gonne, George Hyde, Reginald Maxwell, Oliver Stewart and William Strugnell.

link_mentions.page: List of World War I flying aces from the British Empire
